subject: Physics
question_text: Which of the following phenomena can not be explained by wave theory of light? 2025 (28 Jan Shift 2) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo O μ 0 4π I a [ π 2 + 1] μ 0 4π I a [ 3π 2 + 2] μ 0 2π I a [ π 2 + 2] μ 0 4π I a [ 3π 2 + 1] A −2 ′ 1 3 4 3 1 2 3 = 1000 kg m −3 1400 3 600 3 4000 3 400 3 x 0 p 0 t ω x 0 p 0 (A) (R) (R) (A) 190 g 200 g 300 g 290 g 11.2 km/s km/s 2.8 11.2 5.6 8.4 → √3 2 ^i + 1 2 ^j)30 sin [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 1 2 ^i − √3 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 3 4 ^i + 1 4 ^j)30c cos [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 1 2 ^i + √3 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t + z c )] → E = ( √3 2 ^i − 1 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t + z c )] 2 17 ∘ C
question_latex: Which of the following phenomena can not be explained by wave theory of light? 2025 (28 Jan Shift 2) JEE Main 2025 January JEE Main Previous Year Paper MathonGo O μ 0 4π I a [ π 2 + 1] μ 0 4π I a [ 3π 2 + 2] μ 0 2π I a [ π 2 + 2] μ 0 4π I a [ 3π 2 + 1] A −2 ′ 1 3 4 3 1 2 3 = 1000 kg m −3 1400 3 600 3 4000 3 400 3 x 0 p 0 t ω x 0 p 0 (A) (R) (R) (A) 190 g 200 g 300 g 290 g 11.2 $\frac{km}{s}$ $\frac{km}{s}$ 2.8 11.2 5.6 8.4 → √3 2 ^i + 1 2 ^j)30 sin [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 1 2 ^i − √3 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 3 4 ^i + 1 4 ^j)30c cos [ω (t − z c )] → E = ( 1 2 ^i + √3 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t + z c )] → E = ( √3 2 ^i − 1 2 ^j)30c sin [ω (t + z c )] 2 17 ∘ C
